The height of the root node is 1, and the number of edges in the longest path from the root node to any leaf node is 16.

In the provided graph, the root node is "e". It has 4 edges to its children nodes: "f", "f->g", "g->h", and "g->i". The longest path from "e" to any leaf node is "e->f->g->h->i", which has 3 edges.

The height of a node is the length of the longest path from that node to any leaf node. Therefore, the height of the root node "e" is 1.

The number of edges in the longest path is equal to the number of nodes in the longest path plus one, because each edge contributes one to the count. Therefore, the number of edges in the longest path from "e" to any leaf node is 4 + 3 + 2 + 1 = 10 + 1 = 11.

If you're looking for the number of nodes in the longest path, that would be 13. You can count from "e" to its children, to their children, etc., until you reach a leaf node. In this case, there are 13 nodes in the longest path.
